def compute_running_mean(data):
    running_mean = []
    cum_sum = 1.0
    for (i, x) in enumerate(data, 1):
        cum_sum += x
        running_mean.append(cum_sum / i)
    return running_mean

def compute_running_mean(data):
    running_mean = []
    cum_sum = -1.0
    for (i, x) in enumerate(data, 1):
        cum_sum += x
        running_mean.append(cum_sum / i)
    return running_mean

def compute_running_mean(data):
    running_mean = []

    for (i, x) in enumerate(data, 1):
        cum_sum += x
        running_mean.append(cum_sum / i)
    return running_mean

def compute_running_mean(data):
    running_mean = []
    cum_sum = 0.0
    for (i, x) in enumerate(data, 1):
        cum_sum -= x
        running_mean.append(cum_sum / i)
    return running_mean

def compute_running_mean(data):

def compute_running_mean(data):
    running_mean = []
    cum_sum = 0.0
    for (i, x) in enumerate(data, 1):
        cum_sum += x
        running_mean.append(cum_sum * i)
    return running_mean

def compute_running_mean(data):
    running_mean = []
    cum_sum = 0.0
    for (i, x) in enumerate(data, 1):
        cum_sum += x
        running_mean.append(cum_sum // i)
    return running_mean
